title: Envisioning the future of computing
summary: MIT students participated in the Envisioning the Future of Computing Prize, an essay contest that challenged them to imagine how advances in computing could improve society and the potential dangers associated with them. The students proposed innovative ideas, such as using digital twins to navigate online information and creating personalized storytelling films using AI and biosensors. The winning entry explored the implications of a personalized language model that predicts an individual's writing based on their past texts and emails. The contest aimed to encourage students to think critically about the societal impact of technology.
